alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 19 at 4:14PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...For the Yukon River, from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Nulato, including Galena and Koyukuk * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the Yukon River is now occurring near the Nowitna River area behind a large ice jam. Flooding of low lying areas is expected to move downstream sometime between tonight and Sunday when the ice jam lets loose. Water could rise very rapidly as a surge of water and ice moves downstream. Ice could move onshore near the river bank. Flooding is possible at Galena and Koyukuk sometime between late tonight through Sunday. Fish camps and cabins along the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Nulato could become flooded and sea damage from ice. Ruby and Nulato are not expected to flood due to their elevation above the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - On Friday afternoon, an ice jam remains in place on the Yukon River 20 miles upstream of Ruby. The ice jam is about 40 miles long with ice tightly packed together. Extensive flooding has now formed a large lake along and upstream of the ice jam. The ice is now getting wet and weakening under the sun, and the jam is expected to let loose sometime between tonight and Sunday. When the jam releases, a surge of high water and ice will move rapidly downriver and could flood many low areas near the river and push ice up over the bank, including at Galena and Koyukuk. It is estimated that when the jam breaks it will take 6 to 8 hours for the high water to reach Galena, and another 3 to 4 hours for the high water to reach Koyukuk. This means high water could reach Galena sometime between late tonight and Sunday. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna and Koyukuk Rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Those living in areas prone to flooding should prepare now for possible ice jam flooding. Move valuables to higher ground and prepare to evacuate on short notice. If flooding develops, water will rise very fast.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
